description: The navigator.vibrate() method makes a tactile alert, if the device is equipped with a haptic motor.
description_html: The navigator.vibrate() method makes a tactile alert, if the device is equipped with a haptic motor.
name: Vibration

notes: Beginning in Chrome 55, this is not supported in cross-origin iframes.
Beginning in Chrome 60, this method requires a user gesture. Otherwise it returns false.
Until Firefox 26 included, when the vibration pattern was too long or any of its elements too large, Firefox threw an exception instead of returning false (bug 884935).
From Firefox 32 onwards, when the vibration pattern is too long or any of its elements too large, it returns true but truncates the pattern (bug 1014581).
Beginning in Firefox 72, this is not supported in cross-origin iframes.

firefox_android.notes: Vibration is disabled. If the window is visible, then navigator.vibrate() returns true, but no vibration takes place (regardless of hardware support). Originally, the intent was to disable it for cross-origin frames only (bug 1591113), but the feature was not re-enabled due to abuse concerns (bug 1653318).
